intro: Chamaenerion bordzilovskyi, commonly known as the Caucasian fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky areas and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Chamaenerion bordzilovskyi is known for its resilience and is often found in alpine and steppe habitats.
